revised_title: Folding and Chaperone Interaction of Nascent Chains during Elongation on Ribosomes
tldr: The article investigates the folding process of nascent chains during protein synthesis on ribosomes using monoclonal antibodies. It provides evidence that some ribosome-bound chains can fold even before the synthesis of the complete N-terminal domain, and that they can interact with chaperones while still bound to the ribosome.
